intro: Crassula congesta subsp. laticephala, commonly known as the Woolly Crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features dense, compact growth with fleshy, bluish-green leaves that are covered in a fine, white绒毛, giving it a woolly appearance. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or red during the summer months. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil and minimal water. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
